title: "jackal and the war drum"
moral: "there are many sounds that do not mean danger"

title: "weaver’s wife"
moral: "we all three cooked our own goose"

title: "arrogant and rabbit"
stories: the rabbit lives and the lion dies"

title: "grateful animals and ungrateful man"
moral: "listen to sound advice no matter who gives it"

title: "blue jackal"
moral: "leave friends to cultivate strangers at your peril"

title: "swan and owl"
stories: untimely action and false friends should not be ignored"

title: "gullible camel"
moral: marriage and friendship thrives among equals, but not between rich and poor

title: "lion and carpenter"
moral: king with false advisors can bring harm to his subjects

title: "turtle and two ganders"
moral: "It is best to take advice from true friends"

title: "forethought
column7: ready wit win; accepting fate loses"

title: "jackal who tricked lion"
moral: "I must look out for my own interests in secret "

title: "girl who married a snake"
moral: There are only three things in this world that once given, cannot be withdrawn

title: "unteachable monkey"
moral: Advice and education are wasted on those too stupid to learn

title: "honest and sly"
column7: and an intelligent mind are rare"

title: "cure and disease"
moral: "cure can be worse than the disease"

title: "mice that ate iron"
stories: the hawk can lift an elephant

title: "twin parrots
stories: "even brothers can become prime examples of good and bad education"

title: "sensible foe"
stories: the noble person tries to serve others even at his own expense"

title: "foolish friend"
moral: "beware of making friends with fools and trusting them too much"
